mdRecord.dcterms:title: Museum - Case #5
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Exhibit case in the museum displaying Washington's compass and staff [W-579], several canes, articles of clothing including Martha Washington's bathing gown (far left) [W-580], George Washington's silk stockings [W-574/D-E], Washington's brown suit coat [W-574/A] and an embroidered waistcoat [W-575]. The Museum (1928-2006) was built along the north lane between the spinning house and the greenhouse slave quarters in 1928. It replaced the Relic House which occupied the nearby salt house from 1923-1928. When the Donald W. Reynolds Museum, built underground, opened in 2006, the space was repurposed as the Interpretive Center.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Mount Vernon Black and White Film Collection
